## Information

Apple Inc. is one of the most popular consumer electronics and software companies in the world.
Apple has been around for a long time now, and for good reason because their products are highly popular and are used by people all over the world.
They have always been a company that has been on the cutting edge of technology, and they are always coming up with new and innovative ways to improve the lives of their customers.

body:
import Details from "@w/Details.astro";

## Information
$O is the stock symbol for *Realty Income Corporation*, a real estate investment trust (REIT) that owns and operates over 6,500 commercial properties in the United States and Europe. 
The company motto is "The Monthly Dividend Company" because it is known for paying monthly dividends to its shareholders and has increased its dividend for 109 consecutive quarters since its public listing in 1994.

## Intro

If you are looking for a reliable source of monthly income from your investments, you might want to consider Realty Income Corporation ($O), a real estate investment trust (REIT) that owns and operates over 6,500 commercial properties in the United States and Europe.
Realty Income is known as "The Monthly Dividend Company" because it has paid dividends to its shareholders every month since its public listing in 1994. In fact, it has increased its dividend for 109 consecutive quarters, making it one of the few S&P 500 Dividend Aristocrats.
Realty Income's properties are mostly single-tenant retail buildings leased to well-known tenants such as Walgreens, Dollar General, FedEx, and 7-Eleven. These tenants sign long-term leases with rent increases built in, providing stable and predictable cash flow for the company. Realty Income also diversifies its portfolio by geography, industry, and tenant to reduce risk and enhance growth opportunities.
Realty Income's stock performance has been impressive over the years. It has delivered an average annual total return of 14.6% since 1994, outperforming the S&P 500 index. It also has a low correlation with the broader market, making it a good hedge against volatility. As of March 8, 2023, Realty Income's stock price was $59.27 per share and its dividend yield was 4.14%.
If you are interested in investing in Realty Income, you can buy its shares through any online brokerage platform that offers access to the NYSE. You can also learn more about the company by visiting its website at www.realtyincome.com.
Realty Income is a great example of a REIT that provides consistent and growing income to its investors. By owning high-quality properties with long-term leases, it has built a solid reputation as one of the best dividend stocks in the market.

## Information

The S&P 500 index is a stock market index that tracks ~500 of the largest U.S. companies by market capitalization. 
The index is a product of S&P Dow Jones Indices which is a joint venture of S&P Global and CME Group.

body:
import Details from "@w/Details.astro";

---

## Information

STAG Industrial Inc. a.k.a $STAG, is a real estate investment trust (#REIT) that specializes in acquiring, owning, and operating industrial properties across the United States. 
This means that $STAG invests in properties such as warehouses, distribution centers, and light manufacturing facilities. 
STAG’s focus on industrial properties has allowed it to become a leader in the industrial real estate market with a robust portfolio of strategically located assets.

STAG Industrial chooses which properties to invest in based on a number of factors such as location, tenant creditworthiness, and lease terms.
This allows STAG to be selective in its investments, preferring to buy only properties that are integral to a company’s future business and enables STAG to focus on acquiring high-quality assets that generate stable cash flows and provide long-term value for its shareholders.

---
